metadata.name: Tesla's  Better World
metadata.description:
3D loop animation with Tesla's Invention and Tesla's Vision Of the Better World 3D loop animation with Tesla's Invention 

Tesla's vision of a better world is visualized by creating a bright and colorful environment. 
WARDENCLYFFE TOWER Wardenclyffe Tower (1901â€“1917), also known as the Tesla Tower, was an early experimental wireless transmission station designed and built by Nikola Tesla. 
Pattern Of Tesla Valve A Tesla valve at the back, an Invention named after Nikola Tesla, allows fluid to flow preferentially in one direction, without moving parts. The device is named after Nikola Tesla. Nikola Tesla visioned this with the drawing. 
Tesla's vision of wireless free energy WARDENCLYFFE TOWER is generating wireless electricity to light up the bulb. 

"Bust of Nikola Tesla" (https://skfb.ly/KWJ9) by Mushogenshin K is licensed under CC Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike (http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-nc-sa/4.0/).
